III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section Intervention standards and prohibitions
Description (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 4/23/25, a staff member put both hands around a youth's neck
after the youth scratched a staff member.
Investigation Consumer Rights Officer was interviewed at the facility on
04/24/25 in collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Consumer Rights
Officer reported Youth A is placed on Hope Wing. Youth A has
been at the facility for two months and has 12 incident reports due
to aggressive behavior and assaulting staff.
Youth A was interviewed at the facility on 04/24/25 in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Youth A has been at the
facility for two months. She reported on 04/23/2025 she was trying
to escape off the wing and Supervisor 1 and Staff 1 were trying to
get her to go back to the wing and that’s when Staff 2 intervened
and put his hands around her throat. Youth A said she scratched
and kicked Staff 2 until he let her go. Youth A denied being injured
or having bruises. Youth A said the incident occurred in the
hallway leading to hope wing.
Youth B was interviewed at the facility on 04/24/2025 in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Youth B is placed on Hope
Wing with Youth A. Youth B reported on 04/23/2025 Youth A was
trying to go after Supervisor 1 and ran off the wing. Youth B was
standing by her bedroom door and saw Staff 2 choke Youth A.
Youth B said Youth A also told her that Staff 2 choked her. Youth
B denied any previous incidents involving any staff choking or
hurting her.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed at the facility on 04/24/25 in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Supervisor 1 reported on
04/23/2025 she was in the hallway when Youth A ran off Hope
wing and attempted to assault Supervisor 1, so she ran into the
2

staff lounge. Supervisor 1 did not witness Staff 2 choke Youth A
because she was in the staff lounge.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed at the facility on 04/24/25 in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Supervisor 2 reported on
04/23/2025, he was entering Hope Wing when Youth A pushed
through the door and went after Supervisor 1. He and Staff 1
followed Youth A and attempted to verbally de-escalate Youth A.
Staff 2 was in the hallway and came to assist them. He said Youth
A was the one punching, scratching, and kicking them. He denied
Staff 2 choked or was aggressive with Youth A. Supervisor 2 said
they escorted Youth A back to the wing. He said Youth A was not
hurt or injured and she did not report being choked or hurt.
Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility on 04/24/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Staff 1 reported on
04/23/2025 Youth A told him that she has two imaginary friends,
and they told her to do bad things to Supervisor 1. He said Youth
A pushed through the wing door when Supervisor 2 was coming
on the wing. He and Supervisor 2 followed Youth A and tried to
escort her back to the wing. He said Youth A went after
Supervisor 1 and said, “Bitch I am going to kill you.” Supervisor 1
ran into the staff lounge. He said Staff 2 was in the hallway and
came to assist him and Supervisor 2 to escort Youth A back to the
wing. Youth A began to kick and scratch Staff 2. He said they
eventually escorted Youth A back to the wing. Staff 1 denied Staff
2 choked or put his hands anywhere near Youth A’s neck.
Staff 3 was interviewed at the facility on 04/24/2025. Staff 3 was
on the Hope Wing on 04/23/2025. Staff 3 witnessed Youth A push
through the door when Supervisor 2 was coming in, Youth A went
after Supervisor 1, so Supervisor 2, Staff 1 and Staff 2 escorted
back to the wing. She denied witnessing Supervisor 2, Staff 1 or
Staff 2 choke or assault Youth A. She said Youth A was the one
that was kicking and hitting the staff.
Therapist was interviewed at the facility on 05/02/2025. She
reported Youth A disclosed to her on 04/23/2025 that she was
choked by Staff 2. Youth A denied having any bruises or injuries.
Staff 2 was interviewed at the facility on 05/14/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Staff 2 has been working at
the facility for two years. He reported on 04/23/2025, he witnessed
Youth A run off the wing trying to assault Supervisor 1, he went to
assist Supervisor 2 and Staff 1. He and Supervisor 2 were trying
to escort Youth A back to the wing, when Youth A dropped to the
3

floor, therefore they released the hold. He said Youth A started to
punch and kick him. He got scratched in the neck by Youth A. He
denied at any point assaulting or choking Youth A. He said Youth
A was the one assaulting him.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage dated 04/23/2025 at approximately 2:30 pm, was
reviewed. Youth A is seen pacing the hallway, Supervisor 2, Staff
1, and Staff 2 are blocking Youth A from going down the hallway,
Supervisor 2 and Staff 1 apply the two-person escort one on each
side of Youth A, Youth A dropped to the floor and they release the
hold. Youth A began kicking and punching Supervisor 2, Staff 1
and Staff 2. Youth A then gets off the floor and Staff 1 and
Supervisor 2 escort Youth A back to the wing. At no point in the
video is Staff 2 seen choking Youth A.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 04/23/2025, written by Supervisor 2 is
consistent with Supervisor 2’s interview.
• Vista Maria Staff and Client Interaction policy states
corporal punishment (spanking, paddling, slapping,
pinching, twisting arms, pulling hair, etc.) of youth is never,
under any circumstances, permitted.
• Vista Maria Behavior Management Policy states physical,
or safety intervention techniques will be utilized as an
absolute last resort. Various de-escalation techniques may
be utilized to maintain safety of youth and staff in the
environment. Staff must use the least restrictive, safest,
and most effective methods and recognize that symptoms
are adaptations. All staff are trained on the use of
nonphysical intervention skills such as verbal de-escalation,
and mediation conflict resolution.
• Staff 2 has no disciplinary record.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance based on interviews with staff,
youths, and video footage reviewed there is insufficient evidence
staff choked youth.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.

sir_summary.summary: A special investigation was conducted after an allegation that a staff member at VISTA MARIA placed his hands around a youth's neck during a physical altercation on April 23, 2025. The investigation, which included interviews with staff, youths, and a review of video footage, found insufficient evidence to substantiate the choking allegation, concluding instead that the youth was the primary aggressor. The report's final determination states that no substantial violations were found and the facility is in compliance, effectively assigning no culpability to the staff or facility.
